commentBody:
We live at a time when the leading Republican contender for president demeans a female journalist by nasty references to menstruation, insults a female opponent by sneering about her "disgusting" trip to the bathroom, presumably to urinate, and openly admits he would have sex with his married daughter if she weren't his daughter. We also live at a time when a member of the House of Representatives from a Southern state shouts "You lie!" at the first African American president during a televised State of the Union speech.

Sexist and racist bullying has become entrenched as a way of life. I commend these two women journalists for speaking out.

We've let the worst among us - the angry, the insecure and the unstable - run amok. Enough already. Let's truly make America great again by reinstating civil discourse and reasoned debate.
